headline: Best Western CEO fears for the industry's future: 'It's really bad'
summary: Travel, tourism and hospitality has been at the center of the Covid-19 crunch, hammered by a pandemic that has made many people afraid to travel and use hotels.

headline: Roblox confidentially files to go public
summary: Founded in 2004, Roblox offers users free-to-play games across mobile devices and consoles.

Southwest is expanding in United hubs in Houston and Chicago
summary: Southwest Airlines announced a surprise move into Houston and Chicago's largest airports, a strategy shift that would expand it's presence in United hubs.

headline: Watch live: World Health Organization holds a press briefing on the ongoing coronavirus outbreak
summary: "There are no new answers,"  Dr. Mike Ryan, executive director of the WHO's health emergencies program, said on Friday. "We know what we need to do."

headline: Facebook reverses stance on Holocaust denial, will ban it now
summary: Facebook announced in a blog post Monday it will ban content that "denies or distorts the Holocaust" in a reversal of its earlier stance.

headline: Divided senators open Amy Coney Barrett confirmation hearings with focus on health care: 'This is probably not about persuading each other'
summary: A sharply divided Senate Judiciary Committee opened confirmation hearings for Judge Amy Coney Barrett, President Donald Trump's Supreme Court pick.

headline: 'Get long' — Cramer sees coronavirus trends driving stocks higher no matter who wins election
summary: "There are enough trends out there, established by Covid, that just say, 'Get long. And the No. 1, of course, is the internet just plowing through," CNBC's Jim Cramer said on Monday.

headline: Google announces new Nest Thermostat that uses radar to detect when you're nearby
summary: The Nest Thermostat has a completely new design that looks less clunky. Instead of rotating the face of the unit, you just touch and swipe down the side to increase or decrease the temperature.

headline: Dillard's jumps 15% after one of Buffett's investing lieutenants discloses personal stake
summary: Dillard's pops after Berkshire Hathaway investment manager discloses personal stake.

headline: Dr. Scott Gottlieb: U.S. could never coronavirus test as much as China but it must get better

summary: Banks unofficially kick off the third-quarter earnings season this week. One company’s report should set the tone, according to Piper Sandler's Craig Johnson.

headline: Twilio stock jumps in premarket on $3.2 billion Segment acquisition
summary: The deal is expected to close by the end of the year.

summary: Southwest Airlines' pilots union scoffed at a company proposal to cut pay rates 10% in exchange for no furloughs through 2022.

summary: The OECD has warned that countries need to come to an agreement over digital tax or risk damaging the global economy further.

summary: Lawmakers from countries within the Five Eyes alliance have urged tech firms to develop backdoors that allows them to access encrypted messages.

summary: Consumers in the world's second-largest economy clearly still have cash to spend, even if China as a whole is still recovering from the economic shock of the coronavirus pandemic.
